name: South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa

reviews.title: had a great time only a few problems
reviews.text: I went to the South Coast for my honeymoon. We had a great time! the room was huge and well kept and housekeeping love to give away their soaps and stuff!

reviews.title: great rooms
reviews.text: Teh breakfast buffet was brilliant and very cheap as they give you a coupon in the funbook for 2-1 (and you get a fun book when you check in and another one for joining players club so thats 3 total)
We also ate at the steak house there and i ate the BEST steak of my life there mmmmm i have ben dreaming about it.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!!
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: the shuttle busses are great and one of the drivers its particuly nice and gives a tour and background talk about vegas which was nice.
The trolley busses also stop there aswell if you want a very cheap way to get about to places like the outlet malls
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Too Far From Strip

reviews.text: Well I had my second real stay at South Point. I booked through a host since I did not know if i would receive a mailer I have heard SP is weak on them. My regular host was on vacation but another I had heard of was glad to comp me a couple of nites since I would again split with Silverton. I did receive a mailer a bit before my trip with free nites and some free play so called and used it.
reviews.title: South Point could be my new home base
Very good choice
reviews.text: This time I continued to slowly try some more restaurants this time the oyster bar. Next trip I want try Baja Miguel's. Yes there will be a next time. I like the cafe and I am always up early so get the graveyard specials. I like just going up to the counter. But so many choices.

I really like as a Video Poker that they have a lot of decent VP machines. Yes I did leave some $ there, but at least I have a chance. Michael thanks for that. This may be the reason I stay my next trip all here. Silverton is doing the opposite. My host said I should be good for 4 nites. But I do hate playing the machines near the sports book. Oh that hot dog cart it keeps pulling me over. And they are from my town Vienna dogs with the nice snap in them. Do not take this away although I believe it is quite safe.
reviews.title: Convenient for staying in LV if you DON'T want to be anywhere near the strip

reviews.text: My room was nice on the 14th floor and again just like 6 away from the elevators. I only wish they had a small refrigerator. Nice to keep a couple of beers or some water in. But I make good use of the coffee pot.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: So in a few months too many really I will give Courtney a call about my Nov. trip and maybe all at SP. It has been a few since I have done that. Well see you there for #37.
reviews.title: Won't come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying at a resort next door - and they couldn't extend us out a night, so we thought we'd come and spend our last night at South Point! I tell ya - I wish we had spent our ENTIRE vacation here!
reviews.title: Wish I had been HERE all week!

reviews.text: We had enjoyed the casino, the restaurants, the movie theater, and of course - Bingo - and overall - this is a great hotel! The food is better priced than you'll find on the main strip.. you can get anything from sandwiches for under $10 to full-on fancy meals. The Garden Buffet was pretty decent - but I was pretty disappointed in the Coronado Cafe for any meal other than breakfast - Which - by the way - they have GREAT middle of the night breakfast specials.
reviews.title: Better then going to the strip

reviews.text: The most awesome was our room!!! We had a king bed room over looking the pool. It was clean - the bed was wonderfully comfortable - it was the best night's sleep I'd had all week. The ONLY suggestion I would make - for the rooms that have the outside up-lights focused on them - you still get a lot of bleed from the strong lights all night long. What about attaching a piece of velcro (sticky-back to the wall), and then the opposite piece on the curtain in a couple places to truly black out those very strong lights?
reviews.title: gamblers paradise
Wonderful stay!
reviews.text: The staff was awesome all week long - even when we weren't guests. They have shuttles running to and from the strip and the airport constantly - it was just really a good experience. I would absolutely recommend this to my friends and family - and I look forward to returning to South Point again one day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks South Point!!! I wish I would have been a guest all week!!!!
reviews.title: Spacious rooms and friendly staff but terrible food and atmosphere.
Brand New and Beautiful!
reviews.text: The South Coast is outside of Vegas, but only about 10 min. So if you have a rental, which we HIGHLY recommend!, it's fast to the strip. We stayed for two nights, my
parents stayed for 6. We had comps from other hotels on the strip. But the South Coast
reviews.title: You get more than what you payed for

reviews.text: is BRAND NEW! and smaller, more "homey". Great buffet! The rooms are HUGE! and
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: the bathroom is HUGE! The toilet is in a separate room with the tub/shower, also has it's own phone! Huge closet, iron and iron board, hair dryer, and you get shampoo, cream rinse, ect. All the comforts of home! The beds are so comfy! Pillow top. Every room has a plasma TV! So cool! The pool was not open yet when we were there. And we kinda had a view of some mts. over a wall, but hey, who spends time in the room when in Vegas? We highly recommend this hotel. We will deffinately stay again! Check out my photo's of the outside, room and one of the buffet.
reviews.title: What more could you want?
A Great Surprise
reviews.text: Ok, so I'm sick of reading reviews of this place saying "It's too smokey"...It's vegas. ALL of the casinos are smokey and as a matter of fact I noticed this one to be less smokey than the others.

reviews.title: A good hotel! Nice and friendly hotel staff, except for the Rude Emma !
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the South Coast Hotel in Las Vegas for a week on the third week of June 2006, our stay at the hotel was overall very good, the standard rooms were around 500 sq ft, quite spacious and clean, the food at the buffet were good. The pool was beautiful, there wasn't bugs flying around, a couple of reviews I've read here have mentioned about lots of bugs flying by the pool due to the houses next door, but when we were there, the pool area was very clean, the hotel must have done something to fix up the problem. Upon check in at the hotel, we received a coupon booklet, it has some good deals including two for one breakfast buffet or two for one lunch buffet. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, and also to and from the strip.

One of the reviews I've read here was written by a couple who had mentioned that they stayed at the South Coast and got a few looks by the staff and hotel guest because they are Asians, and they have noticed that most of the hotel guests were North American (Whites). It's very unfortunate that they had that experience. However, my husband and I are Asians, and we did not get any looks, actually during our week long stay at the hotel, we have noticed that the overall hotel guests were quite multi-cultural, it was a good mixture, and we are very glad about the multi cultural, we are from Toronto.
reviews.title: South Coast Rocks!

reviews.text: The housekeeping staff were mostly very nice and polite, except for Emma - she is a very rude and terrible housekeeping staff, she has zero customer service, and personally I think she really needs to take a course in Anger Management.
reviews.title: A budget hotel in a mid-luxury setting
Loved the South Coast
reviews.text: When I go to a new place, I have this habit of doing a general check-up on the room to make sure everything is clean and good, especially the bed, it has to be clean. So after we got into our room upon check in, I looked at the sheets and the pillow on the bed, I found several dark colored stains on the bed sheet, and a couple pieces of hair on the pillow, so my husband went to the hallway and asked a housekeeping staff to change the bedding for us. About ten minutes later, this housekeeping lady just rushed into our room, her name is Emma (according to her name tag), she did not even knock on the door, she just used her key card and came in, she did not even say hello or anything, the first sentence came out of her mouth was "What's the problem with the bed? Where are the stains?" So I showed her the stains and I also mentioned about the hair I found on the pillow, she said the pillows are all fresh and clean. Then she changed our bed sheets with an attitude. After that, I asked her to change our pillows for us, she said "Why, the pillows are fresh and clean?" Then I said to her "I found several pieces of long hair on the pillow, how do you explain this?" She replied "Who knows, maybe it's from the air in the room." She then left our room with a very angry face to get the new pillows, then I realized that one of our light bulbs was out, so I followed her and mentioned it to her, when I was talking to her, she was facing another housekeeping staff, when the other housekeeping staff said to our rude housekeeping staff (Emma) that "I think this lady is talking to you." Without even looking at me, all Emma said was "I know she's talking to me, and I heard what she said." So then I went back to my hotel room, a few minutes later, our rude housekeeping staff Emma came back to our room and put the pillows on the bed, she then used our room phone to call the main housekeeping phone number and told me that one of our light bulbs needs to be replaced. Then without a word to us, she left and slammed our door. I then realized that the small bottle of lotion in our bathroom was almost empty, usually it should be full. So again I went to find Emma, she was just a couple of doors down from our room, before I even opened my mouth, she said to me "I'm very busy, what do you want?" I said to her "Well, obviously I have another enquiry, otherwise I wouldn't be bothering you right now." Without even looking at me, she said "Call downstairs, I'm very busy, don't bother me!" I couldn't believe her attitude, her attitude went from worse to unbelievably worse! She just seemed to be a very angry person, she really needs to take a course in Anger Management!

A couple of minutes later, we got a knock on the door, so I went and opened the door, this nice lady with a smile said to me "I'm just doing a room check. I asked her who I can call to make a complaint about the housekeeping staff." She told me that she is the Supervisor of the housekeeping department, she said I can call the housekeeping Director about the complaint, and she also asked me if there's anything she can help me with. So I told her everything that had happened re Rude Emma's unprofessional attitude, after Supervisor heard everything I said, she apologized, and she made notes to what I said, she told me that she will forward this to the housekeeping Director.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, customer service lacking

reviews.text: I was going to be in Las Vegas for 8 hours overnight between flights and was simply looking for a cheap decent room for the night.
reviews.title: Perfect for a cheap night in Vegas

likes.disliked: — Its a long way from the strip

reviews.text: South Point was $65 incl all taxes. Perfect. Booked from the hotel website.
reviews.title: Value and fun south of the Strip

likes.liked: — Generally excellent hotel at very reasonable price

reviews.text: I didn't see much of the hotel. Arrived at 11:00pm and left on the 6:00am shuttle back to the airport. The room was huge and perfectly comfortable with large lcd TV and everything one would need. The Internet was $12 / 24 hours but I didn't use it. Used none of the hotel facilities except the free shuttle in the morning which was great.
reviews.title: Non-smoking room, supposedly, with 3 ashtrays and matches....

likes.disliked: — non-smoking room smelled like smoke and had 3 ashtrays, TV signal not HiDef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that this hotel is 6 miles south of Mandalay Bay (ie the end of the strip) and the taxi fare there in the evening was $38 incl tip. However, having been on the shuttle i get the feeling that the taxi driver may have taken the long way round.
reviews.title: Wonderful Off-theStrip Hotel

likes.liked: — Coupon book and even if it was off the strip, it was still pretty convenient via short drive
likes.disliked: — no fridge and no fitted sheet on bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I have another layover I'd do it again. If I was wanting to do Las Vegas I'd stay on or nearer the strip.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: I had heard positive things about South Point and decided to give it a try for a few nights. I had never really stayed off strip in Vegas, ( only the Orleans which is very close) but the rates were so low and the place looked nice so I gave it a shot. Lets start with the positives since they far outweight the negatives.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, but not without a few minor flaws...

likes.liked: — Size of rooms, lack of pool crowds.
likes.disliked: — Buffet, some very unfriendly casino dealers.

reviews.text: The exterior of the hotel is very grand-- Much like any nice hotel on the strip. One postive thing we realized right away is that this hotel is not complicated in its layout, unlike many of the other big resorts that feel like mazes at times. The check-in counter is right near the entrance, and you enter right into the casino. The casino is nice and spacious, well lit, and has an airy and open feel about it. Finding our room was very simple, and not a long hike. Basically thats the way the entire hotel felt. Even though its a big place, everything feels nearby and easy to find. We got a mid-level room.. it was on the 17th floor and provided a good view of the pool and mountains. I would advise others to pay the extra 10$ or so a night and get a room with a good view. As far as the room itself, it was great! Huge and very well decorated. Probably the best room I have ever seen for that price. It had a very large bathroom with the always desired seperate vanity area. No complaints about the room whatsoever. One of the other biggest postives about the south point is their pool. Its not the grandest or most decadent in Vegas by any stretch, but its still very nice. And what made it even greater for me was the lack of crowds. Even on Satruday the pool was at most half full. You had your choice of chairs. And on Tuesday it almost felt like we had the pool to ourselves. South Point also has a great selection of restaruants. We tried about 3 or 4 of them.
reviews.title: Vegastastic!!

likes.liked: — Location and Rooms. They were huge!
likes.disliked: — There's just nothing to dislike about the South Point!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for a few negatives. For one, I thought the buffet was quite lousy. Even on Sunday morning. The selection was mediocre and the food did not taste fresh.Kind of a downer. Also they were playing loud music at 830am. Thats the last thing you want to hear while eating breakfast hungover in Vegas. The Black jack dealers were among the least friendly I have ever come across. One guy almost frightened me he seemed so angry. This is not a knock against the casino itself, just the people they seem to hire. The sportsbook was excellent, but VERY crowded on Sunday for football. Almost impossible to get a seat. And there were hundereds of them. And one more minor complaint is about the shuttle to strip. For some reason it only takes you to Mandalay Bay. Which is great if you are going there or right nearby, but most people end up going to the center strip. So you either had to pay another 10-15$ for cab to take you farther down, or walk the 20-30mins in the heat. We chose the taxi. I really think they should extend the shuttle to take people a little further up-- maybe to the Flamingo.
reviews.title: Delightful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all its a excellent value, and we had a great time. Like any place it has a few flaws, but for that price we both were very pleased with what we experienced at South Point.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I had visted Vegas previously and I must admit, I had my reservations about staying "off The Strip". On arrival all those reservations quickly dissapeared. The South Point is absolutely superb. This hotel is enormous but luxuriuos. Yes, its quite a way off the Strip but the hotel provides modern air-conditioned courtesy buses that run throughout the day, up to half a dozen times an hour. You are never waiting for more than ten minutes for a bus to turn up and whip you down to the Madalay Bay. Pickups from the Strip run much later into the evening than other lesser-hotels situated Off-Strip.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the South Point was not planned or intended, but due to the Volcanic eruption in Iceland closing airspace over Europe.
reviews.title: Stranded at the South Point due to Volcano!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having a fab week in Vegas at the Wynn Hotel, our BA flight home to the UK was returned to LV due to the Volcanic eruption. BA put us into the South Point as an interim measure, where we faced uncertainty about our travel back home.
reviews.title: Good place, great buffet, great cocktails

reviews.text: As mentioned, this stay was a total surprise, but I wanted to thank the staff at South Point for making our stay pleasant and bearable during a traumatic time for us and the 450 + BA passengers offloaded there!
reviews.title: Comfortable and Friendly at Bargain Rates

reviews.text: I won't harp on about the volcano or our personal issues with getting a flight re-booked, but would like to say that the South Point really is a great hotel; even though it was hard to stay positive in the situation we were placed.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay. Highly Recommend

reviews.text: It is off strip, away from the hussle and bussle, but it is a little, (or quite large actually) gem with tons of amenities and a great atmosphere. The hotel has many facilities, bowling, bingo, restaurants, equestrian centre, games area, casino and a cinema complex as well as boasting a very nice pool with jacuzzis and pleasant spa area.
reviews.title: Poor treatment of guests

reviews.text: Go to Vegas twice a year. Skip the strip!!! The South Coast is worth the drive!!! This place soars above the Strat! Move over Alladdin!! Skip the castles!!! Don"t clown around with the Circus Circus! The price is right. It is the cleanest hotel! The rooms are very nice. The plasma tv is great. The food is great. The staff is always there for you. The pool is great!!! No crowds!!! Don"t miss this one!!
reviews.title: The best!!!!!!!

reviews.text: My fiancee and I just got back from our trip to a friends wedding, and we stayed at the South Coast. Everything was extremelly clean and very nice, and there are tons of stuff to do there. Even though we don't have any kids, South Coast has an amazing bowling alley, arcade, and kid sitting service.
reviews.title: Great Service and Great Rooms

reviews.text: The rooms were top notch, very big and set up very nicely.
reviews.title: Incredible Value! Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: One of the best parts about the hotel was the service, we didn't meet one employee who didn't seem pleased to serve us or help. The Coronado Cafe is the 24 hour restaurant at South Coast, but don't be fooled, the food is a great deal and excellent quality. Highly suggested!
reviews.title: Kids and I had fun at the South Coast
Not big on customer service
reviews.text: We stayed at the South Coast for two nights June 15-17. The staff was friendly and the room was very nice. Truly enjoyed our stay. Great pricing at the restaurants in the hotel and the food was good too. Not fabulous but who can complain about eating a buffet for 2 utilizing the coupon book we received at check in for only $6!!? Also, the cocktails flowed freely when we were gambling. We tipped each time and the staff seemed most appreciative. Although the best bet seemed to be playing the video poker machines. My husband made $20 last over 2 hours while I lost $60 at the slots in less than 30 minutes. We hung out at the pool the remainder of the afternoon. Drinks were reasonable and not watered down as one might expect. We took the shuttle to the Barbary Coast that evening. A little tip... if you plan to utilize the shuttle going to the sister hotel Barbary Coast, make certain you are out and waiting 30 minutes before departure or you won't get on. These shuttles filled so fast! Also, make sure you check the airport shuttle times from the hotel so you book the best departure time out of Vegas. Our flight left at 11:10 and the morning shuttle times available were 6, 7 and 11 a.m. Overall though, we had a wonderful time and truly enjoyed our stay. It was nice to be off the strip. Much quieter and very relaxing. Would definitely stay here again!!

We arrived early , Knowing the rooms would not be ready, we attempted to go and do some bowling, only to be told a a grumpy, and obviously very un happpy person that no bowling was available until 3pm ! , no good for us, So we tried the Cafe, Food was OK, Server was OK, not a grumpy as bowling Man ! , Then when paying the Bill, The Cashier was very rude to us, as we had our CC Cloaned recently, we had a "temp DEbit Card" with no name on, and was made to feel like a criminal, being blunty told they can not accept this, luckly we did have some other means to pay. Well that was enough for us, We left, before we even checked it. There is a Huge Choice in Vegas at the Moment, And we will go to another Hotel, where we will get some respect and proper Service.
reviews.title: Rude Rude & Rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time we have stayed at the South Point. Apon arriving at the hotel the front desk was very pleasent and we were able to check in right away. we were given a coupon book at check and did use the free lunch buffet coupon. Which was nice. There were a lot of choices and the food was good. You do however notice the smell of smoke as soon as you walk in the casino. But it is a casino and people do smoke in there, it wasn't bothersome and quickly forgot about it. The rooms are nice size with big flat panel tv's in all rooms. I did not enjoy the bed at all. Not enough pillows either, i did not request more. Air worked fine and you could not hear it come on at all.
reviews.title: Ok hotel, very Inconvenient loctation.

reviews.text: As for the casino. Drink service is almost nonexistant. My husband and I received one drink the entire time we where playing, the cocktail waitresses are not very friendly and don't come around very often. We are not big gamblers so we don't spend alot of time at the tables or the slots.
reviews.title: Avg stay this time

reviews.text: We took the shuttle to the strip one day, it was only $8 per person (if you pay cash). The shuttle drops you off at the fashion something mall. Which is fine but it was a bit of a walk to get to the strip, and then it is down on the far end near TI.
reviews.title: Always good but now seems even better

reviews.text: The pool was the best part of the entire trip. Very nice and lots of sun and shade. there is a good size kids pool as well. If I where to bring the kids this would be the perfect place to go, very low key and lots of things for the family to do. I don't we will stay again but we did enjoy ourselves. The one thing I thought was strange is that you have to pay to use the fitness center.
reviews.title: Horrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay, good clean room with large tv. Car hire is a must but they do supply a free courtesy bus to Mandalay Bay.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Going on timeshare presentations was a good way to get a cheap holiday as you get free show tickets, buffet meals as well as money. Well worth sitting through the boring presentations!
reviews.title: Nice with some issues

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. Room is large, nicely decorated. Very large window with views of the strip to the north. Bathroom was nice and very large. Room had a closet with safe, large flat panel tv mounted above the dresser.
reviews.title: My Favorite Vegas Hotel

reviews.text: Now for the issues. The check in was fast yet I didn't think the girl was very outwardly friendly. I can live with that. The Friday seafood buffet was good but crowded. Line for a table moved fast enough yet the guy seated his friends before us and we were there before them. Waitress was good though. Food was typical Vegas buffet which was ok. Orlean's buffet is better. USE THE COUPONS IN THE BOOKLET THEY GIVE YOU AT CHECK IN.!!!!!The housekeeping did do a nice job WHEN they did it. We were there from Friday to Sunday and they never cleaned our room. Granted we slept in on Saturday but left leaving the sign to service the room. Came back 4 hours later and nothing. While napping they came to the door with a man saything he was assigned our room. We said we were here for 2 nights and they left. Front desk must have made a mistake. We left Saturday to go to a show around 5pm, still leaving the service the room sign out. Nothing happened.
reviews.title: great value that exceeds expectations

likes.liked: — the great rooms and excellent facilities
likes.disliked: — the front desk staff at check in were just okay...

reviews.text: Word of warning though. Do NOT get out of your car in the night in Vegas unless you are in a hotel lot. My husband was assaulted by an angry hispanic motorist. He ended up going to ER with a broken nose. Police made no arrest seeing they did not witness it. This happened on the street corner outside of the hotel. Hotel security was excellent at coming to our aid though.
reviews.title: No Complaints!!!

reviews.text: Only stayed there one night to catch Ralphie May in concert, very nice place , large rooms , very clean and no issues with noise. Casino layed out very well. Craps Tables $5 , most BJ tables $5. Wife easly earned enough points on slots for a couple of free buffets . The only issue I had and it's not the casino's fault. There were alot of kids running around maybe beacuse it was a holiday weekend.
reviews.title: Good Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However if your without transportation it may not be the best choice .
reviews.title: Comfortable and Hassle Free

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and cleanliness and comfort.
likes.disliked: — A bit too smoky in the casino.

reviews.text: To start, I booked my room on their web-site and later discovered that Expedia was 38 dollars cheaper. I called the hotel and was cheerfully refunded the difference.
reviews.title: Highly recommended
Fantastic
reviews.text: At check-in, we were greeted by a pleasant and friendly associate.
The room was superb, clean, comfortable and quiet. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on.
reviews.title: very big rooms

description: South Point Hotel, Casino & Spa is located in the heart of the premiere southwest Las Vegas valley, just minutes away from the famous Las Vegas Strip. Our distinctive hotel features spacious rooms and suites with 42-inch plasma televisions, Point Plush mattresses and Wireless Fidelity throughout. Some of our many amenities include a world class spa and fitness center, a 16-screen Century Theatre movie complex, a 64-lane bowling center and a handful of restaurants that cater to all appetites and tastes. Our casino features a large selection of table games and the latest slot and video poker machines. A unique feature to this property is its Equestrian Center, which is the finest horse facility in the country. South Point also has a fabulous 400-seat showroom that features headliner entertainment and dancing to live bands on weekends. Stop by the South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa today, we are sure you will want to stay.
